ngiemboon: Mbalam tóo jʉʼó, ńgɔɔn né Mbalag ngie à kwɛ́ mejʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ tà e gwɔ́ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńnáa melúm mefòŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a lâ mekùkwòon sɔɔnmbʉ́a né yé.
en: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.”

ngiemboon: Mbalag gÿo yɛ̌ mmó gie à tsẅǐ né yé, pɔ́ yé pú ńzẅé tàʼ ndúm fòŋ pɔ́ tàʼ kùkwòon na yɛ̌ yɛ̌ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́ɔ, ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ.
en: So Balak did as Balaam directed, and they offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

ngiemboon: Mbalam gɔɔn né Mbalag ngie: «Ké néŋe pɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn, á ngʉ̀ŋe shúm pwɔʼ sie ɔ̀ náa e sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm. Mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ge náʼa sẅɛʼte nnɛ́. Á ge gǎa wɔ́ɔ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nyɛ mbùm ye mbwó mèŋ. N ge shwóŋo gú mmó gie à gÿǒ, n zsé.» Á kwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm tsɔ́ lekwɛ́ sie tsɔ́ mmó té wó wɔ́.
en: Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here by your burnt offering while I am gone. Maybe the Lord will meet with me. I will tell you whatever he reveals to me.” So he went to a barren hill.

ngiemboon: E Ssé tóo jʉʼó, ńnyɛ mbùm yé mbwó Mbalam, Mbalam gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N gÿǒ mé kwɛ́ mejʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, n dɔgɔ tàʼ ndúm fòŋ pɔ́ tàʼ kùkwòon ńnuŋe pwɔʼ na yɛ̌ yɛ̌ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́ɔ.»
en: God met with him and Balaam said to him, “I have arranged seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie Mbalam ge gÿo gɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi á piŋ nzèm né lejʉ́ŋ Mbalag.
en: Then the Lord put a message in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak and say what I tell you.”

ngiemboon: Mbalam gʉa ńkẅɛ́te Mbalag, á tyé pɔ́ jʉʼ gie shúm pwɔʼ ée wó, é sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, pâ mekěm láʼa Mowab.
en: So he returned to Balak, who was standing there by his burnt offering with all the officials of Moab.

ngiemboon: Mbalam lɔgɔ fǒloŋ ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Balaam proclaimed his poem:

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́, ńkuʼu lénéŋ ndòon
en: How can I curse someone God has not cursed?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tyé ndùm metàʼshʉ̀a metǒon,
en: I see them from the top of rocky cliffs,

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ kuʼu lézsé nzẅìŋ pʉ̀a láʼ Ésàlayɛ?
en: Who has counted the dust of Jacob

ngiemboon: Mbalag gɔɔn né Mbalam ngie: «Ɔ̀ gÿo lêkɔ́ na mèŋ lɛ, n dɔgɔ́ gú ńtóo jʉʼɔɔn légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge néŋ ndòon twó megàŋmbù pɔ́ɔn. Ɔ̀ piŋ ḿpfɛte pɔ́ mbʉ́lè na pɔ́b la!»
en: “What have you done to me? ” Balak asked Balaam. “I brought you to curse my enemies, but look, you have only blessed them! ”

ngiemboon: Mbalam tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ayɔ́ɔn fàʼ té gwɔ́ pɔ́ létsẅii mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a cʉ́me mbwó mèŋ wɔ́ le?»
en: He answered, “Shouldn’t I say exactly what the Lord puts in my mouth? ”

ngiemboon: Mbalag gíŋe ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Tóo pɔ̀gɔ gʉa ńtyé jʉʼʉ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ gie ɔ̀ ge pú ne gyá pa Ésàlayɛ metsèm. Áa jʉʼɔɔn, ɔ̀ ne ńgyá pɔ́ tsɔ́ gwǒŋ na pɔ́b. Ɔ̀ ge tóo jʉʼó, é néŋ ndòon twó pɔ́b ná né mèŋ.»
en: Then Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place   where you can see them. You will only see the outskirts of their camp; you won’t see all of them. From there, put a curse on them for me.”

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ Mbalam ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndùm lekwɛ́ Pisenga; á jʉʼʉ lemaʼá náŋ, á tóo jʉʼó, ńgíŋe ńkwɛ́ mejʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ tà é kuʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńdɔgɔ tàʼ ndúm fòŋ né tàʼ kùkwòon, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ na yɛ̌ yɛ̌ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́ɔ.
en: So Balak took him to Lookout Field   on top of Pisgah,  # 23:14 Nm 21:20; Dt 3:17,27; 4:49; 34:1; Jos 12:3; 13:20 built seven altars, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

ngiemboon: Mbalam gɔɔn né Mbalag ngie: «Néŋe jʉʼɔɔn, á ngʉ̀ŋe shúm pwɔʼ sie ɔ̀ nǎa, é sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, n gʉa tà ńkúu na gi jʉʼ, ńzẅíʼte nkʉ̀ gẅie Ssé ge ná.»
en: Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here by your burnt offering while I seek the Lord over there.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tóo lejʉ́ŋ Mbalam, ńnéŋe shwóŋo gie à ge gɔɔn ncwò ye, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie à piŋ nzèm né lejʉ́ŋ Mbalag.
en: The Lord met with Balaam and put a message in his mouth. Then he said, “Return to Balak and say what I tell you.”

ngiemboon: Mbalam gʉa ńkẅɛ́te Mbalag, á ké ńtyé pɔ́ jʉʼ gie shúm pwɔʼ ée wó, é sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, pâ mekěm láʼ Mowab. Mbalag zɛ́te Mbalam ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie kɔ́?»
en: So he returned to Balak, who was standing there by his burnt offering with the officials of Moab. Balak asked him, “What did the Lord say? ”

ngiemboon: Mbalam lɔgɔ fǒloŋ ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Balaam proclaimed his poem:

ngiemboon: E Ssé te nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie à cÿɔ́nò wɔ́,
en: God is not a man, that he might lie,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka zẅíŋe lénéŋ mbʉ́lè na yɔɔn láʼ,
en: I have indeed received a command to bless;

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a te ne ńgyá tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ na pɔ́b wɔ́,
en: He considers no disaster for Jacob;

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la lɔg metʉ̀ páʼ me nɔ̀ɔnnnɛ́, é mie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ te mǒ kuʼ, éfó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅile wɔ́b.
en: God brought them out of Egypt;

ngiemboon: Anò ngàŋlekàŋ té láʼ pa Ésàlayɛ wɔ́, anò ntsɔ̀ʼngɔ̌ɔn té na tsìŋendá Yakwɔ̂b wɔ́.
en: There is no magic curse against Jacob

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn láʼ lu ssé páʼ púʼntʉ̀:
en: A people rise up like a lioness;

ngiemboon: Mbalag gɔɔn né Mbalam ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn te ne ńkwoŋo lénéŋ ndòon twó pɔ́b wɔ́, ɔ̀ fó ńkúʼte mbùm jú lénéŋ mbʉ́lè na pɔ́b la!»
en: Then Balak told Balaam, “Don’t curse them and don’t bless them! ”

ngiemboon: Mbalam tsɔ́ʼ né yé ngie: «N da ké ńzɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋo gú ngie, n ge cÿó nnɛ́, é gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅǐ!»
en: But Balaam answered him, “Didn’t I tell you: Whatever the Lord says, I must do? ”

ngiemboon: Mbalag gíŋe ńgɔɔn né Mbalam ngie: «Tóo! N ge gíŋe lɔgɔ gú gʉa tyé na tsɔ́ jʉʼʉ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, ngwɔ́ tsɔ́, e Ssé tóo jʉʼó ńzẅíŋ, ɔ̀ néŋ ndòon twó yɔɔn láʼ né mèŋ.»
en: Again Balak said to Balaam, “Please come. I will take you to another place. Maybe it will be agreeable to God that you can put a curse on them for me there.”

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ Mbalam ńgʉa né ndùm lekwɛ́ Peyɔɔ, á jʉʼ gie mé tyé wó ḿbú ńgyá nkùɔmekwaʼá.
en: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.  ,# 23:28 Nm 21:20

ngiemboon: Mbalam tóo jʉʼó, ńgɔɔn mbwó yé, à kwɛ́ mejʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, tà é gwɔ́ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ ńná melúm fòŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a lâ mekùkwòon sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: Balaam told Balak, “Build me seven altars here and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.”

ngiemboon: Mbalag gÿo mmó gie à tsẅǐi né yé, ḿbiŋ ńzẅé tàʼ ndúm fòŋ pɔ́ tàʼ kùkwòon na yɛ̌ yɛ̌ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́ɔ, ńdɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ.
en: So Balak did as Balaam said and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
